subject: Re: [junit] parallel test directories and eclipse
msgSnippet: ... From: Bill de hÓra  To: junit  Sent: Wednesday, November 13, 2002 12:59 PM Subject: [junit] parallel test
messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Bill de hÓra" <dehora@...>
To: "junit" <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, November 13, 2002 12:59 PM
Subject: [junit] parallel test directories and eclipse


> Hi,
>
> Has anyone had any success getting Eclipse to understand a project
> whose junit code is organized as follows:
>
> src/
> java/
> a/b/c
> test/
> a/b/c
>
> I imagine it can be done, but I've not been able to get Eclipse to
> shut up - it says it can't find src/test's dependencies, ie the ones
> in src/java
>
> Bill de hÓra
>
>
Have you tried defining two source directories for the project. One would be
src/java and the other test/java. I use this method extensively without
problems.

Jonathan Gossage
